revised_title: Vegetation History and Climate Changes in Western Tasmania
tldr: This study examines the vegetation history and climate changes in western Tasmania through pollen analysis of peat, swamp-soil, and lake sediments dating from 0 to over 43,800 years before present. The research identifies three major pollen assemblage zones, revealing the area's transition from temperate rainforest to grassland and back to sub-alpine vegetation over time. The findings are compared with other sites in Tasmania, Chile, and New Zealand, providing insights into the region's environmental history.
